title: APT / CLEANING LADY
description: Cleaning lady inside the apartment building. Part of her greeting is in PIER / APARTMENTS PIER DOOR dialogue.

dialogueTree.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Give me a moment..." The cleaning..."
dialogueTree.text: "Give me a moment..." The cleaning lady still seems to be having difficulty breathing.

links.title: You: ""Who are you?""
links.text: "Who are you?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I'm no one, just an old woman who..."
links.text: "I'm no one, just an old woman who cleans these hallways."

links.title: You: ""Do you live here?""
links.text: "Do you live here?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""If you can call it living..." She..."
links.text: "If you can call it living..." She spits on the floor, before wiping it off with a broom. "I have a little room upstairs, right next to the coal room."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""It's barely bigger than a closet,..."
links.text: "It's barely bigger than a closet, but I don't complain, no..." She juts out her chin, eyes shining. "I have my bed and my aching bones to keep me company and that's all I need from this world."

links.title: Shivers: "And all she gets, too. The coastal..."
links.text: And all she gets, too. The coastal wind beats down hard on the coal room door, outside. Splashes of waves make the balcony slippery...

links.title: Rhetoric: "She hasn't spoken to anyone for a w..."
links.text: She hasn't spoken to anyone for a while. Even her sentences feel rusty.

links.title: You: ""Do you know anything about a *secr..."
links.text: "Do you know anything about a *secret meeting* that's happening tonight?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""What?" She frowns. "No. Nobody tel..."
links.text: "What?" She frowns. "No. Nobody tells me anything."

links.title: Logic: "Would she understand if they did?"
links.text: Would she understand if they did?

links.title: You: ""How about any unusual activity tak..."
links.text: "How about any unusual activity taking place after hours? Say after 22.00?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""If it ain't my business I keep my..."
links.text: "If it ain't my business I keep my nose out of it..." She shakes her head and mutters to herself.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Think we'd all be better off if pe..."
links.text: "Think we'd all be better off if people kept their noses to themselves."

links.title: You: ""I am looking for Martin Martinaise.""
links.text: "I am looking for Martin Martinaise."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Oh, you'll find plenty of Martins..."
links.text: "Oh, you'll find plenty of Martins here, don't you worry!" She smiles a gap toothed smile when she hears you mention the name.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean? I wasn't joking.""
links.text: "What do you mean? I wasn't joking."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Pea-brain, someone played a trick..."
links.text: "Pea-brain, someone played a trick on you. Martin Martinaise is a name for *anyone* from Martinaise. Like Jim Jamrock or Raoul Revachol."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Oops... you really didn't get the j..."
links.text: Oops... you really didn't get the joke there.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I thought it was obvious..." He st..."
links.text: "I thought it was obvious..." He stops before he offends you. "Anyway, officer. We *don't* have the witness' name."

links.title: You: ""No, you don't understand. I'm look..."
links.text: "No, you don't understand. I'm looking for a real person named Martin Martinaise. He told me he's Martin Martinaise."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a young male in hi..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a young male in his mid-twenties, dark hair, skinny build. A smoker on the balcony."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Yes-yes. I know who you mean. The..."
links.text: "Yes-yes. I know who you mean. The scrawny boy who's always smoking like the devil, right?" She looks at the other end of the hallway.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Somewhere in the building a child s..."
links.text: Somewhere in the building a child starts crying. You hear a radio tuned to a talk show and someone taking a shower.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""What's he in trouble for?""
links.text: "What's he in trouble for?"

links.title: You: ""No trouble, I just want to talk to..."
links.text: "No trouble, I just want to talk to him. Do you know where he lives?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Talk!" The cleaning lady starts la..."
links.text: "Talk!" The cleaning lady starts laughing, but it turns into a violent coughing spasm. She squeezes her broom, trying to catch her breath.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What was so funny about that?"
links.text: What was so funny about that?

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""He lives upstairs in room #28. Go..."
links.text: "He lives upstairs in room #28. Go to the balcony. It's one of those doors there," she points east. "He's usually home in the evening."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you." He turns to you. "We s..."
links.text: "Thank you." He turns to you. "We should go check out his apartment on the balcony, see if he's home."

links.title: You: ""He's wanted for murder. He's goin'..."
links.text: "He's wanted for murder. He's goin' away for life."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's actually *not* wanted for mur..."
links.text: "He's actually *not* wanted for murder. We just want to talk with him."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Murder!" The cleaning lady starts..."
links.text: "Murder!" The cleaning lady starts laughing, but it turns into a violent coughing spasm. She squeezes her broom, trying to catch her breath.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I'd wager you've got the wrong man..."
links.text: "I'd wager you've got the wrong man. But even so, you're out of luck, policeman -- I saw him leave the building just before you came in."

links.title: You: ""Even so, I'd like to talk to him.""
links.text: "Even so, I'd like to talk to him."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for Billie Méjean's ap..."
links.text: "I'm looking for Billie Méjean's apartment. Could you direct me?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""It's about Victor, isn't it?" She..."
links.text: "It's about Victor, isn't it?" She narrows her pale grey eyes. "It's always about Victor with her... You'll find the Méjeans in apartment #20 upstairs. It's one of the doors on the balcony."

links.title: You: ""I am looking for the parents of a..."
links.text: "I am looking for the parents of a kid named Cuno."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""De Ruyters are at the end of this..."
links.text: "De Ruyters are at the end of this hallway, right next to the communal bathroom."

links.title: You: ""I didn't find any counterculture p..."
links.text: "I didn't find any counterculture people in apartment #10 -- it was just a real estate agent setting up the room for new tenants."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I see..." She takes out her handke..."
links.text: "I see..." She takes out her handkerchief and wipes her nose. "I hope some good people are finally going to move in. This place needs them."

links.title: You: ""Yes. Radiocomputer wizards are com..."
links.text: "Yes. Radiocomputer wizards are coming. They're gonna save the place -- and the economy."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Oh, I do like wizards," she agrees..."
links.text: "Oh, I do like wizards," she agrees wholeheartedly. "And people like that in general. They have a lot to tell us about our fates..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "She means clairvoyants."
links.text: She means clairvoyants.

links.title: You: ""Yes. Some highly technological wiz..."
links.text: "Yes. Some highly technological wizards are going to save this place. It'll be an visionary innovation utopia."

links.title: You: ""No one is coming. There will be no..."
links.text: "No one is coming. There will be nothing but squalor unless we start killing real estate agents."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""*We* won't be killing anyone. And..."
links.text: "*We* won't be killing anyone. And *you* shouldn't say things like that. You're a police officer... there's been enough killing. I've *seen* it..." She coughs.

links.title: Empathy: "She's seen it -- and known those wh..."
links.text: She's seen it -- and known those who have been killed.

links.title: You: ""Lax women and sexual deviants. Tha..."
links.text: "Lax women and sexual deviants. That's who'll come." (Spit.)

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I know those types, yes. There hav..."
links.text: "I know those types, yes. There have been some here, but they never make their rent. So they have to move out. I know their type..." She coughs.

links.title: Authority: "She appreciates your effort to curb..."
links.text: She appreciates your effort to curb the deviantry and laxness.

links.title: You: ""I'm sure everything will be fine...."
links.text: "I'm sure everything will be fine. This apartment building needs *slow* change. Imperceptibly slow."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Yes, well..." She doesn't know wha..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." She doesn't know what to say so she just coughs and repeats: "I hope they're good people."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Your statements are too vague to co..."
links.text: Your statements are too vague to comment on.

links.title: You: ""I have a few questions about those..."
links.text: "I have a few questions about those apartments..."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Ask away, policeman.""
links.text: "Ask away, policeman."

links.title: You: ""Do you know who lived in the forec..."
links.text: "Do you know who lived in the foreclosed apartment?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The hell am I supposed to know?" T..."
links.text: "The hell am I supposed to know?" The cleaning lady shrugs, her mouth puckered like a dried fig. "Another nut job, I assume."

links.title: Half Light: "She really doesn't like those *nut..."
links.text: She really doesn't like those *nut jobs*. Bad blood there.

links.title: You: ""Why is there a hole in the wall in..."
links.text: "Why is there a hole in the wall in the abandoned apartment?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Some lunatic lost his mind... All..."
links.text: "Some lunatic lost his mind... All kinds of morons pass through these halls."

links.title: Empathy: "With how small these rooms are -- w..."
links.text: With how small these rooms are -- wouldn't you want to break the wall down?

links.title: You: ""Is one of the residents on a vacat..."
links.text: "Is one of the residents on a vacation? Their mailbox is overflowing."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""People come and go, I don't keep a..."
links.text: "People come and go, I don't keep an eye on everyone."

links.title: Logic: "They probably just moved -- or died..."
links.text: They probably just moved -- or died, hopefully somewhere else.

links.title: You: ""Who lives in apartment #10?""
links.text: "Who lives in apartment #10?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""No one lives there, it's been empt..."
links.text: "No one lives there, it's been empty for months."

links.title: You: ""But I talked to someone through th..."
links.text: "But I talked to someone through the door."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Impossible," the cleaning lady say..."
links.text: "Impossible," the cleaning lady says, shaking her head, "I would know if someone had moved in there." She pauses, eyeing the hallway.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Maybe it's those *counterculture p..."
links.text: "Maybe it's those *counterculture people* again? Breaking into our house like it's a public space... You're a policeman, be good and take a look, will you?"

links.title: You: ""Sure, I'll go see what I can find...."
links.text: "Sure, I'll go see what I can find." (Take it on.)

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Great. Young people, they're worse..."
links.text: "Great. Young people, they're worse than rats, you know -- always littering the hallways with trinkets and empty beer cans..."

links.title: You: ""The police has better things to do..."
links.text: "The police has better things to do." (Nope.)

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Suit yourself, Mr. Important. No o..."
links.text: "Suit yourself, Mr. Important. No one cares about this building any way..."

links.title: You: ""But I heard someone walking inside.""
links.text: "But I heard someone walking inside."

links.title: You: ""Who lives behind the padlocked doo..."
links.text: "Who lives behind the padlocked door?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Oh, that one is a scientist, a fut..."
links.text: "Oh, that one is a scientist, a future scholar!" Suddenly the old lady's face is beaming.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I think he studies astrology at th..."
links.text: "I think he studies astrology at the community college. Education's good, I always tell them to study."

links.title: You: ""Astrology?""
links.text: "Astrology?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Something to do with all those sta..."
links.text: "Something to do with all those stars around his door. He asked me to leave his drawings up on the wall."

links.title: You: ""You mean the star-and-antlers? I t..."
links.text: "You mean the star-and-antlers? I think that's the symbol of communism."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The symbol of what now?""
links.text: "The symbol of what now?"

links.title: You: ""Communism. You know, like in the w..."
links.text: "Communism. You know, like in the world revolution?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Never heard of it," the cleaning l..."
links.text: "Never heard of it," the cleaning lady replies, before another coughing spell takes hold of her.

links.title: You: ""You know, the ones who support the..."
links.text: "You know, the ones who support the working class against Capital."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Huh," the cleaning lady says, "I t..."
links.text: "Huh," the cleaning lady says, "I thought Revachol *was* the capital."

links.title: You: ""It's an ideology. It has some nobl..."
links.text: "It's an ideology. It has some noble aims, but it's also been used to justify terrible bloodshed."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: "The cleaning lady shrugs and return..."
links.text: The cleaning lady shrugs and returns to sweeping.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The clash of ideas and atrocities a..."
links.text: The clash of ideas and atrocities are as far from her world as fairies and wizards.

links.title: You: ""It's for loons who have no idea ho..."
links.text: "It's for loons who have no idea how economy works."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Economy? Why should anyone care ab..."
links.text: "Economy? Why should anyone care about economy?!" She shrugs and returns to sweeping.

links.title: You: ""It's a symbol for contributing to..."
links.text: "It's a symbol for contributing to the demise of our noble state in the name of some made-up world of 'equality'."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I don't believe in equality. Never..."
links.text: "I don't believe in equality. Never seen it work." She shakes her head and returns to sweeping.

links.title: You: ""Communism. It's a political ideolo..."
links.text: "Communism. It's a political ideology."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Ah!" the cleaning lady says, leani..."
links.text: "Ah!" the cleaning lady says, leaning on her broom. "All I know about politics is that it has brought us more harm than good."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure you don't mean astron..."
links.text: "Are you sure you don't mean astronomy?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""That's what I said, astrology.""
links.text: "That's what I said, astrology."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shakes his head, as..."
links.text: The lieutenant shakes his head, as though to say 'let it go.'

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "C'mon people, try to keep up *any*..."
links.text: C'mon people, try to keep up *any* standards here. It's not about stars, it's... forget it.

links.title: You: ""Tell me about the man who lives at..."
links.text: "Tell me about the man who lives at the end of the hallway -- Uuno de Ruyter."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I don't want to talk about de Ruyt..."
links.text: "I don't want to talk about de Ruyters," the cleaning lady mutters. She starts digging for something in her pockets.

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.text: "Why not?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Addicts, all of them... And someti..."
links.text: "Addicts, all of them... And sometimes I hear them screaming." She winces.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""They don't like me cleaning behind..."
links.text: "They don't like me cleaning behind their door, think I'm listening in on their fights."

links.title: Half Light: "So she doesn't. Not after *that one..."
links.text: So she doesn't. Not after *that one time*. There's a *that one time* here.

links.title: Empathy: "It didn't get physical. She heard s..."
links.text: It didn't get physical. She heard something she doesn't want to hear again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We saw unpaid utility bills -- are..."
links.text: "We saw unpaid utility bills -- aren't they going to be evicted?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""No one likes them in this building..."
links.text: "No one likes them in this building." She shakes her head. "It's only because of the kid they haven't been thrown out."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I don't like talking about those p..."
links.text: "I don't like talking about those people," she looks down the hallway.

links.title: You: ""I saw unpaid utility bills -- aren..."
links.text: "I saw unpaid utility bills -- aren't they going to be thrown out?"

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I don't like talking about them,"..."
links.text: "I don't like talking about them," she says mostly to herself.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It was dirtier there. After the jan..."
links.text: It was dirtier there. After the janitor's closet. She avoids the end of the hallway.

links.title: You: ""Who lives in apartment #12? I hear..."
links.text: "Who lives in apartment #12? I heard snoring."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The de Ruyters..." She frowns. "He..."
links.text: "The de Ruyters..." She frowns. "He's chained it and fallen into a stupor again."

links.title: You: ""Sounds like he has.""
links.text: "Sounds like he has."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The less said about those people,..."
links.text: "The less said about those people, the better."

links.title: Half Light: "She's scared of room #12."
links.text: She's scared of room #12.

links.title: You: ""What can you tell me about Cindy?""
links.text: "What can you tell me about Cindy?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The *artist*?" She scoffs. "Nothin..."
links.text: "The *artist*?" She scoffs. "Nothing I can do about her, I'm afraid. She ruins the walls faster than I can clean them. Still..." She leans on her broom.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""She leaves an old lady to her busi..."
links.text: "She leaves an old lady to her business. More than I can say for others..."

links.title: You: ""That's all, thanks.""
links.text: "That's all, thanks."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: "She mumbles some kind of a response..."
links.text: She mumbles some kind of a response, then hacks something into her handkerchief.

links.title: You: ""Thanks, I'm off." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Thanks, I'm off." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Give me a moment." An elderly woma..."
dialogueTree.text: "Give me a moment." An elderly woman is leaning on her broom, her knuckles white as bone. She seems to be having difficulty breathing.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""The cold never does any good for m..."
links.text: "The cold never does any good for my bronchitis..." She sneezes into a dirty handkerchief.

links.title: Endurance: "This woman's health is failing her...."
links.text: This woman's health is failing her. There's not much to do, not in this damp.

links.title: You: ""First, I'm the policeman that aske..."
links.text: "First, I'm the policeman that asked you to open the door. Are you sure you don't want to see my badge?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I already told you I don't care ab..."
links.text: "I already told you I don't care about any badges."

links.title: You: ""Are you alright? Should I call a d..."
links.text: "Are you alright? Should I call a doctor?"

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""I'm fine, fine, don't you worry ab..."
links.text: "I'm fine, fine, don't you worry about me!" She starts coughing, red spots appearing on her cheeks.

links.title: Empathy: "You're still worried. It's very wor..."
links.text: You're still worried. It's very worrying.

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Now, what do you want from me, pol..."
links.text: "Now, what do you want from me, policeman?"

links.title: You: ""This won't take long, I only have..."
links.text: "This won't take long, I only have a few questions."

links.title: Cleaning Lady: ""Go ahead then. What do you want to..."
links.text: "Go ahead then. What do you want to know, policeman?"

links.title: Logic: "She's the cleaning lady. She knows..."
links.text: She's the cleaning lady. She knows the floor plan and the residents.

links.title: You: "Let's do it later... [Leave.]"
links.text: Let's do it later... [Leave.]
